revised_title: Advancements and Applications in Molecular-Ion Spectroscopy
tldr: This article discusses the rapid growth and advancements in molecular-ion spectroscopy, a field that studies charged molecules and their behavior. The technology and methods used in this field have improved significantly, allowing for the detection and analysis of molecular ions in various environments, such as interstellar clouds, cometary atmospheres, and combustion processes. Molecular-ion spectroscopy has provided insights into the chemistry of early Universe and the formation of complex organic molecules in molecular clouds, as well as the role of molecular ions in electrolytes and plasma environments. The future of molecular-ion spectroscopy holds promise for further advancements and applications, particularly in understanding combustion processes and the potential development of fusion power.
